title: A million bottles a minute: world's plastic binge 'as dangerous as ...
body: Between 5m and 13m tonnes of plastic leaks into the world's oceans each year to be ingested by sea birds, fish and other organisms, and by 2050 the ocean will contain more plastic by weight...
readable_content:
- The article is dated June 28th, 2017.
- A million plastic bottles are bought around the world every minute, with the number expected to increase by 20% by 2021.
- More than 480 billion plastic drinking bottles were sold in 2016, and the figure is projected to increase to 583.3 billion by 2021.
- Efforts to collect and recycle plastic bottles are failing to keep up with their usage. Fewer than half of the bottles bought in 2016 were collected for recycling, and just 7% of those collected were turned into new bottles.
- Between 5 million and 13 million tonnes of plastic leak into the world's oceans each year and could potentially affect the human food chain.
- Experts warn about the need for urgent action to address the plastic pollution crisis.
- Major drinks brands, such as Coca-Cola, produce a large number of plastic bottles, contributing to the environmental issue.
- Campaigners are pressuring big drinks companies to increase the amount of recycled plastic in their bottles.

The information provided is enlightening about the scale of the global plastic bottle consumption and its potential impact on the environment.
